TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit XamlServices extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides higher-level services (static methods) for the common XAML tasks of reading XAML and writing an object graph; or reading an object graph and writing XAML file output for serialization purposes.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The modes of the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlServices> class that are used in the most common XAML reading and writing scenarios rely on creating instances of XAML readers and XAML writers. These readers and writers are specialized but internal implementations of public classes, such as <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader>, <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader>, and <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectWriter>. To use <xref:System.Xaml.XamlServices> for most scenarios, you can rely on the default internal implementations to obtain the results that you want. For more specialized scenarios, you might define readers and writers yourself, and then pass them as arguments for overloads of the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlServices> methods.
> [!IMPORTANT] > <xref:System.Xaml.XamlServices> is not the recommended XAML reading or XAML writing API set if you are processing WPF-defined types, or types based on WPF. For [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] usage, use <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XamlReader?displayProperty=fullName> for reading or loading XAML (or BAML); and <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XamlWriter?displayProperty=fullName> for writing back XAML. These classes use .NET Framework XAML Services APIs and the XAML readers and XAML writers internally in their implementation; however, they also provide support and specialized XAML schema context for WPF-specific concepts, such as optimizations for dependency properties and WPF known types.

MemberSignature.Value: public static object Load (System.IO.Stream stream);
.method public static hidebysig object Load(class System.IO.Stream stream) cil managed

Docs.param: The stream to load as input.
Docs.summary: Loads a source for a XAML reader and writes its output as an object graph.
Docs.returns: The object graph that is written as output.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Different signatures for the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlServices.Load%28System.IO.Stream%29> method specify different types of input for the source XAML. The <xref:System.Xaml.XamlServices.Load%28System.IO.Stream%29> internal implementation first creates an <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> by calling <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader.Create%28System.IO.Stream%29> and then creates a new instance of a specialized <xref:System.Xaml.XamlReader> that processes the input.
In order for the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlServices.Load%28System.IO.Stream%29> call to successfully create an object graph, the following must be true:
- The source is well-formed and valid XML.
- The source is valid XAML at the language level.
- The XAML types that are specified in the source XAML must resolve to backing types in the relevant XAML namespaces. For example, XAML types for WPF namespaces can resolve to a WPF XAML namespace as specified in the XAML; the assemblies for WPF must be included in the project or available in the run time; and so on.
> [!IMPORTANT] > <xref:System.Xaml.XamlServices> is not the recommended XAML reading or XAML writing API set if you are processing [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] types, or types based on [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)]. For [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] usage, use <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XamlReader?displayProperty=fullName> for reading or loading XAML; and <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XamlWriter?displayProperty=fullName> for writing back XAML. These classes use <xref:System.Xaml> APIs internally in their implementation; however, they also provide support for WPF-specific concepts that influence the nature of XAML reading and writing, such as optimizations for dependency properties.

MemberSignature.Value: public static object Load (System.IO.TextReader textReader);
.method public static hidebysig object Load(class System.IO.TextReader textReader) cil managed

Docs.param: The to use as the basis for the created .
Docs.summary: Creates a XAML reader from a , and returns an object graph.
Docs.returns: The object graph that is returned.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In order to return the object graph, the `textReader` input should be constructed by using its relevant input. For example, it should pass a <xref:System.IO.StringReader> that is constructed by using a valid XAML-as-string input for the <xref:System.IO.StringReader.%23ctor%28System.String%29> constructor.

MemberSignature.Value: public static object Load (string fileName);
.method public static hidebysig object Load(string fileName) cil managed

Docs.param: The file name to load and use as source.
Docs.summary: Loads a source for a XAML reader and returns an object graph.
Docs.returns: The object graph that is returned.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Different signatures for the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlServices.Load%2A> method specify different types of input for the source XAML. The <xref:System.Xaml.XamlServices.Load%2A> internal implementation first creates an <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader> by calling <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader.Create%28System.String%29> and then creates a new instance of a specialized <xref:System.Xaml.XamlReader> that processes the input.
In order for the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlServices.Load%28System.String%29> call to successfully create an object graph, the following must be true:
- The source is well-formed and valid XML.
- The source is valid XAML at the language level.
- The XAML types that are specified in the source XAML must resolve to backing types in the relevant XAML namespaces. For example, XAML types for WPF namespaces can resolve to a WPF XAML namespace as specified in the XAML; the assemblies for WPF must be included in the project or be available in the run time; and so on.

MemberSignature.Value: public static object Load (System.Xaml.XamlReader xamlReader);
.method public static hidebysig object Load(class System.Xaml.XamlReader xamlReader) cil managed

Docs.param: The XAML reader implementation to use as the reader for this operation.
Docs.summary: Loads a specific XAML reader implementation and returns an object graph.
Docs.returns: The object graph that is returned.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You should typically use this signature only in the following cases:
- You defined your own implementation of a <xref:System.Xaml.XamlReader>.
- You specified settings for a <xref:System.Xaml.XamlReader> that differ from the default settings.

MemberSignature.Value: public static object Load (System.Xml.XmlReader xmlReader);
.method public static hidebysig object Load(class System.Xml.XmlReader xmlReader) cil managed

Docs.param: The implementation to use as the reader for this operation.
Docs.summary: Loads a specific XML reader implementation and returns an object graph.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You should typically use this signature only if you defined your own implementation of a <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader>.

MemberSignature.Value: public static object Parse (string xaml);
.method public static hidebysig object Parse(string xaml) cil managed

Docs.param: The XAML string input to parse.
Docs.summary: Reads XAML as string output and returns an object graph.
Docs.returns: The object graph that is returned.

remarks.format:
## Remarks In order for the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlServices.Parse%2A> call to successfully create an object tree, the following must be true:
- The `xaml` input is well-formed and valid XML.
- The `xaml` input is valid XAML at the language level.
- The XAML types that are specified in the `xaml` input must resolve to backing types in the relevant XAML namespaces. For example, XAML types for a WPF namespace can resolve to a WPF XAML namespace as specified in the XAML; the assemblies for WPF must be included in the project or be available in the run time; and so on.
> [!IMPORTANT] > <xref:System.Xaml.XamlServices> is not the recommended XAML reading or XAML writing API set if you are processing [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] types, or types based on [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)]. For [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] usage, use <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XamlReader?displayProperty=fullName> for reading or loading XAML, and <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XamlWriter?displayProperty=fullName> for writing back XAML. These classes use <xref:System.Xaml> APIs internally in their implementation; however, they also provide support for WPF-specific concepts that influence the nature of XAML reading and writing, such as optimizations for dependency properties.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string Save (object instance);
.method public static hidebysig string Save(object instance) cil managed

Docs.param: The root of the object graph to process.
Docs.summary: Processes a provided object tree into a XAML node representation, and returns a string representation of the output XAML.
Docs.returns: The XAML markup output as a string.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The output from this method is the `ToString` result of an <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriter> that is created by the method call. That <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriter> is created by using the following settings: <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriterSettings.Indent%2A?displayProperty=fullName> is `true`; and <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriterSettings.OmitXmlDeclaration%2A?displayProperty=fullName> is `true`.
The returned string can be loaded as valid XML through the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader.Create%2A> method if you processed the string into a stream, or into a reader more specifically dedicated for XAML.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void Save (System.IO.Stream stream, object instance);
.method public static hidebysig void Save(class System.IO.Stream stream, object instance) cil managed

Docs.param: The destination stream.
The root of the object graph to process.
Docs.summary: Processes a provided object graph into a XAML node representation and then into an output stream for serialization.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!IMPORTANT] > <xref:System.Xaml.XamlServices> is not the recommended XAML reading or XAML writing API set if you are processing [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] types, or types based on [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)]. For [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] usage, use <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XamlReader?displayProperty=fullName> for reading or loading XAML; and <xref:System.Windows.Markup.XamlWriter?displayProperty=fullName> for writing back XAML. These classes use <xref:System.Xaml> APIs internally in their implementation; however, they also provide support for WPF-specific concepts that influence the nature of XAML reading and writing, such as optimizations for dependency properties.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void Save (string fileName, object instance);
.method public static hidebysig void Save(string fileName, object instance) cil managed

The root of the object graph to process.
Docs.summary: Processes a provided object graph into a XAML node representation and then writes it to an output file at a provided location.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `fileName` parameter value is used as the `outputFileName` input for a call to <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriter.Create%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, which creates a <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriter> as part of the method call.

The root of the object graph to process.
Docs.summary: Processes a provided object graph into a XAML node representation and then writes it to the provided XAML writer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You should typically use this signature only in the following cases:
- You defined your own implementation of a <xref:System.Xaml.XamlWriter>.
- You specified settings for the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlWriter> that differ from the default settings.

The to use.
Docs.summary: Connects a and a to use a common XAML node set intermediary. Potentially transforms the content, depending on the types of readers and writers that are provided.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is a wrapper around <xref:System.Xaml.XamlServices.Transform%28System.Xaml.XamlReader%2CSystem.Xaml.XamlWriter%2CSystem.Boolean%29>, where `closeWriter` is specified as `true`.

Docs.exception: The XAML schema context does not match between the provided and .

The to use.
to close the writer after the call is complete; to leave the writer active at the last written position.
Docs.summary: Connects a and a to use a common XAML node set intermediary. Potentially transforms the content, depending on the types of readers and writers that are provided. Provides a parameter for specifying whether to close the writer after the call is completed.
